doc.after: A major fire broke out in the Parthenon shortly after the middle of the third century AD[56][57] which destroyed the Parthenon's roof and much of the sanctuary's interior.[58] Repairs were made in the fourth century AD, possibly during the reign of Julian the Apostate.[59] A new wooden roof overlaid with clay tiles was installed to cover the sanctuary. It sloped at a greater incline than the original roof and left the building's wings exposed.[58]
